workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 2.1 - Watopia Hilly Forward
workout_file.description: A race simulation on Watopia Hilly Forward where you'll tackle 3 laps of the course.

textevent.message: Welcome to a race simulation for Watopia Hilly Forward!
Let's get started with 7mins nice and easy to warmup.
Keep your cadence comfortable here.
Let's do a quick check for your fan, fluids, and towel.
All right, let's see what's in store for you today.
We have a race simulation to tackle today on Watopia Hilly Forward.
If you haven't raced on this course, I have some news for you...It's brutal!
You will either be full gas or recovering today.
And this is especially true on the KOM section, which starts right after the start.
So, tip #1 for this course is get a really good warmup in since it starts off VERY hard.
We'll do 3 laps today. Let's carry on with the warmup 1st though :-)
Next up we have 2 high cadence efforts to wake up the legs a bit more.
Aim for 110+ RPM here.
UP UP UP! FAST FEET!
Great work! 1 down and 1 to go.
GO GO GO!
Excellent! Let's take a recovery now and get ready for the main set.
We're starting with a hard effort, just like any Zwift race would :-)
Then, pretty much immediately after tackling the 1st ascent of the KOM.
So, get ready to WORK over the next few minutes! Start spinning your legs up now.
GO GO GO! Hard effort to stay close to the front of the pack.
Up and over the short rise after the start ramp.
And a very quick recovery before we start the KOM...Breathe here.
Prepare yourself now...This is going to tickle a little.
LET'S GO! This is a brutal climb, but is relatively short.
Stay focused here and keep tapping out that rhythm.
Don't grind the gear here, keep it up!
1min to go and we're at the top of the climb! DIG DIG DIG!
We're heading right to zone 3 after this and recovering a little of the flats.
Phew! Great effort there! Time to recover under pressure now and stay in the draft.
Breathe...That climb will take a lot out of your legs every lap. Recover now.
We have a short rise coming up where people love to go wild...Prepare yourself again!
Put in a short dig here to stay with the group! We have a descent coming up next.
Nicely done! Now we'll scream down the descent and pass under the sculpture.
Catch your breath here, we'll put in some work again next on our way to the Esses.
Another short rise here leading into town, DIG!
Great work! We're passing by the waterfall and through the sprint point now.
Remember, don't go for the green jersey in a race :-)
Next up are the Esses where people will try and attack, especially on this 1st climb.
Stay with the group here, but let the attacks go since they rarely, if ever, work this far out.
GO GO GO! Up this short and steep riser!
Into the Esses now! Things will be strung out after that climb, stay in the group!
And recover down the backside.
Excellent work! Let's descend back into town towards the start line to begin lap 2 now.
Short riser coming up again that leads us to the KOM...Get ready to WORK!
Small dig here.
Recover now...The KOM awaits next!
Here we go again! The attacks will come fast and furious on this section, don't lose the group!
C'mon! Stay in the wheels and don't get dropped! DIG DIG DIG!
People will try to attack when the climb flattens out, keep the pressure on!
Just a little longer now! Then we're settling down into zone 3 again.
Great work! You made it over the KOM twice now in the group. Time to recover here.
Some may attack here too when they know the field is weakened, so always pay attention up the road.
1min to go, then we'll surge over that slight rise before the descent.
UP UP!
Excellent! Now our longest bit of recovery on course. Deep breaths here.
Prepare for a pesky surge next up and over the hill towards the sprint point.
Pick it up again!
Well done. Onto the flats once again now as we rip through the sprint point.
Take a couple sips of fluid here and get ready for the hard climb to the Esses just ahead.
LET'S GO! Make it over this hill in the field!
Excellent! Stay towards the front of the field through the Esses again and don't get caught out.
People will start to lose wheels as they fatigue, so be extra vigilant now.
And back down into town to start the bell lap! Just 1 more KOM climb to go!
Punch it up this short rise!
No rest here on this lap, people will be very excited getting to the KOM start.
SMASH THIS! Even harder for this final lap as people really go for the win here.
Halfway done! The nice thing about going harder is you also finish sooner :-)
DON'T GIVE UP NOW!
Straight back to zone 3 now, recover with what's left of the group after that brutal climb!
Take a couple sips of fluid here too as you recover.
Get ready to surge up and over the climb before we descend - Stay with it!
GET GOING!
Beautiful work! Let's rip it down the descent now and recover here. Almost done today!
UP UP! Stay with the wild childs here :-)
Awesome! Onto the final flat section of the course today.
Now's the time to think about your race closing strategy...
Will you sprint from the field? Attack through the Esses? Figure that out now.
And use your known strengths as well as how you feel currently to make that decision.
Most importantly though, whatever you decide to do, STICK WITH IT!
Here comes the final part of this race...Things are going to really be popping off here.
Get ready to push it up this climb even harder this time!
Wring out those legs! You can do this!
Splits will have for sure formed after that, stay near to the front through here!
Breathe...Get ready for the push to the line and final sprint!
Working down the descent this time! Stay near the front here, but not on it ideally.
Use your sprint to work through the field staying in the draft as long as possible.
WIND IT UP! GO GO GO!
DON'T GET PINCHED AT THE LINE! UP UP UP!
YEAH! Way to go, my friend! You crushed it today!
We're going to take a few minutes and cooldown now, you earned it!
See you next time :-)
